definition: rhyming couplet/pair of lines of verse written vertically down the sides of a doorway/CL:副[fu4],幅[fu2]
antithesis (two lines of poetry matching in sense and sound)/to fight/to wage war
riddles written on lanterns (e.g. for the Lantern Festival at the end of Chinese New Year)
to conclude a treaty/to make an agreement/contract (at bridge)
to inscribe a poem (often, composed on the spot) on a painting, fan or ceramic bowl etc as a work of calligraphy/an inscribed poem
courting/meeting for purpose of marriage/to settle into a relationship
parents of one's daughter-in-law or son-in-law/relatives by marriage
worthy or virtuous person/honorific used for a person of the same or a younger generation
